intro: Hieracium pilosella subsp. albulae, commonly known as the white-haired hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the daisy family. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
